00001 /* 
00002  * jcom.in~
00003  * External for Jamoma: manage audio inputs for a module
00004  * By Tim Place, Copyright © 2006
00005  * 
00006  * License: This code is licensed under the terms of the GNU LGPL
00007  * http://www.gnu.org/licenses/lgpl.html 
00008  */
00009 
00010 
00011 /*
00012         The user specifies @channel_config mono or @channel_config stereo 
00013         as arg to the module.  That makes the hub responsible for cleaning
00014         up any unused inlets and outlets for the configuration.  
00015         
00016         It may also signal to the module to handle the poly differently,
00017         i.e. if the algorithm should be true stereo instead of multi-mono
00018         
00019         This all means that we need this object to subscribe to the hub.
00020 */
00021 
00022 #include "Jamoma.h"
00023 #include "jcom.in.h"
00024 
00025 // Globals
00026 t_class         *in_class;                                      // Required. Global pointing to this class
00027 t_atom          ga_zero;
00028 
00029 
00030 /************************************************************************************/
00031 // Main() Function
00032 
00033 int main(void)                          // main recieves a copy of the Max function macros table
00034 {
00035         long            attrflags = 0;
00036         t_class         *c;
00037         t_object        *attr;
00038         long            offset;
00039         
00040         jamoma_init();
00041 
00042         // Define our class
00043 #ifdef JCOM_IN_TILDE
00044         c = class_new("jcom.in~",(method)in_new, (method)in_free, (short)sizeof(t_in), (method)0L, A_GIMME, 0);
00045 #else
00046         c = class_new("jcom.in",(method)in_new, (method)in_free, (short)sizeof(t_in), (method)0L, A_GIMME, 0);
00047 #endif
00048 
00049         offset = calcoffset(t_in, common);
00050         class_obexoffset_set(c, offset + calcoffset(t_jcom_core_subscriber_common, obex));
00051 
00052         // Make methods accessible for our class: 
00053         class_addmethod(c, (method)in_dispatched,                       "dispatched",                   A_GIMME, 0L);
00054         class_addmethod(c, (method)in_algorithm_message,        "algorithm_message",    A_GIMME, 0L);
00055         class_addmethod(c, (method)in_view_internals,           "open",                                 A_GIMME, 0L);   // method used to view algorithm
00056         class_addmethod(c, (method)in_link,                                     "link_out",                             A_CANT, 0L);    // maybe used to forward messages in jmod.in
00057         class_addmethod(c, (method)in_unlink,                           "unlink_out",                   0L);
00058 #ifdef JCOM_IN_TILDE
00059         class_addmethod(c, (method)in_dsp,                                      "dsp",                                  A_GIMME, 0L);
00060         class_addmethod(c, (method)in_remoteaudio,                      "remoteaudio",                  A_CANT, 0);
00061 #else
00062         class_addmethod(c, (method)in_bang,                                     "bang",                                 0L);
00063         class_addmethod(c, (method)in_int,                                      "int",                                  A_LONG, 0L);
00064         class_addmethod(c, (method)in_float,                            "float",                                A_FLOAT, 0L);
00065         class_addmethod(c, (method)in_anything,                         "list",                                 A_GIMME, 0L);
00066         class_addmethod(c, (method)in_anything,                         "anything",                             A_GIMME, 0L);   
00067 #endif
00068         class_addmethod(c, (method)in_release,                          "release",                              A_CANT, 0L);    // notification of hub being freed
00069     class_addmethod(c, (method)in_assist,                               "assist",                               A_CANT, 0L);
00070 
00071         jcom_core_subscriber_classinit_common(c, attr, offset); 
00072         
00073         // ATTRIBUTE: algorithm_type
00074         attr = attr_offset_new("algorithm_type", _sym_symbol, attrflags,
00075                 (method)0, (method)0, calcoffset(t_in, attr_algorithm_type));
00076         class_addattr(c, attr);
00077         
00078         // ATTRIBUTE: num_inputs
00079         attr = attr_offset_new("num_inputs", _sym_long, attrflags,
00080                 (method)0, (method)0, calcoffset(t_in, num_inputs));
00081         class_addattr(c, attr); 
00082 
00083 #ifdef JCOM_IN_TILDE
00084 //      // ATTRIBUTE: manage_channels
00085 //      attr = attr_offset_new("manage_channels", _sym_long, attrflags,
00086 //              (method)0, (method)0, calcoffset(t_in, attr_manage_channels));
00087 //      class_addattr(c, attr);
00088         
00089         // Setup our class to work with MSP
00090         class_dspinit(c);
00091 #endif
00092 
00093         // Finalize our class
00094         class_register(CLASS_BOX, c);
00095         in_class = c;
00096 
00097         atom_setlong(&ga_zero, 0);
00098         return 0;
00099 }

00102 /************************************************************************************/
00103 // Object Life
00104 
00105 // Create
00106 void *in_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00107 {
00108         long            attrstart = attr_args_offset(argc, argv);               // support normal arguments
00109         t_in            *x = (t_in *)object_alloc(in_class);
00110         short           i;
00111                 
00112         if(x){
00113                 x->dumpout = outlet_new(x, NULL);
00114                 x->algout = outlet_new(x, NULL);
00115                 
00116                 object_obex_store((void *)x, ps_dumpout, (object *)x->dumpout);         // setup the dumpout
00117 
00118                 x->num_inputs = 0;
00119                 x->attr_algorithm_type = _sym_nothing;
00120                 x->attr_bypass = 0;
00121                 x->attr_mute = 0;
00122                 x->attr_freeze = 0;
00123                 x->vector_size = 0;  // reset cached vector size
00124 
00125                 if(attrstart > 0){
00126                         int argument = atom_getlong(argv);
00127                         x->num_inputs = TTClip(argument, 0, MAX_NUM_CHANNELS);
00128                 } 
00129                 else
00130                         x->outlet[0] = x->algout;  // no arguments send any input out the first outlet
00131 
00132 #ifdef JCOM_IN_TILDE
00133                 if(x->num_inputs > 0)
00134                         dsp_setup((t_pxobject *)x, x->num_inputs);              // Create Object and Inlets
00135                 else
00136                         dsp_setup((t_pxobject *)x, 1);                                  // Create Object and Inlet
00137 
00138                 x->common.ob.z_misc = Z_NO_INPLACE | Z_PUT_FIRST;
00139                 
00140                 for(i=0; i < (x->num_inputs); i++)
00141                         outlet_new((t_pxobject *)x, "signal");                  // Create a signal outlet
00142                 
00143                 x->signal_in = new TTAudioSignal(MAX_NUM_CHANNELS);
00144                 for(i=0; i < MAX_NUM_CHANNELS; i++){
00145                         x->remote_vectors[i] = NULL;
00146                 }
00147                 in_alloc(x, sys_getblksize());                                          // allocates the vectors for the audio signals
00148 #else
00149                 for(i = x->num_inputs-1; i >= 1; i--)
00150                         x->inlet[i] = proxy_new(x, i, 0L);
00151                 for(i = x->num_inputs-1; i >= 0; i--)
00152                         x->outlet[i] = outlet_new(x, 0L);
00153 
00154 #endif
00155                 jcom_core_subscriber_new_common(&x->common, ps__jcom_in__, ps_subscribe_in);
00156                 jcom_core_subscriber_setcustomsubscribe_method(&x->common, &in_subscribe);
00157                 attr_args_process(x, argc, argv);                                       // handle attribute args                                
00158                 defer_low(x, (method)jcom_core_subscriber_subscribe, 0, 0, 0);
00159         }
00160         return (x);                                                                                             // Return the pointer
00161 }
00162 
00163 
00164 // deferred function for registering with the jcom.hub object
00165 void in_subscribe(void *z)
00166 {
00167         long            argc;
00168         t_atom          a;
00169         t_atom          *argv = &a;
00170         t_symbol        *result;
00171         t_symbol        *modtype;
00172         t_in            *x = (t_in *)z;
00173         
00174         if(x->common.hub != NULL){
00175                 // Find out what type of algorithm this is supposed to control
00176                 object_attr_getvalueof(x->common.hub, ps_algorithm_type, &argc, &argv);
00177                 result = atom_getsym(argv);
00178                 if(result == ps_default){
00179                         object_attr_getvalueof(x->common.hub, ps_module_type, &argc, &argv);
00180                         modtype = atom_getsym(argv);
00181                         
00182                         if(modtype == ps_audio)
00183                                 x->attr_algorithm_type = ps_poly;
00184                         else if(modtype == ps_video)
00185                                 x->attr_algorithm_type = ps_jitter;
00186                         else
00187                                 x->attr_algorithm_type = ps_control;
00188                 }
00189                 else
00190                         x->attr_algorithm_type = result;
00191         }
00192 }
00193 
00194 
00195 // Destroy
00196 void in_free(t_in *x)
00197 {
00198 #ifdef JCOM_IN_TILDE
00199         dsp_free((t_pxobject *)x);                      // Always call dsp_free first in this routine
00200         delete x->signal_in;
00201 #endif
00202         jcom_core_subscriber_common_free(&x->common);
00203 }
00204 
00205 
00206 // Notification that the hub no longer exists
00207 void in_release(t_in *x)
00208 {
00209         jcom_core_subscriber_hubrelease(&x->common);
00210         x->out_object = NULL;
00211 }

00214 /************************************************************************************/
00215 // Methods bound to input/inlets
00216 
00217 // Method for Assistance Messages
00218 void in_assist(t_in *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst)
00219 {
00220         if(msg==1)      // Inlets
00221                 strcpy(dst, "(signal) input to the module");
00222         else if(msg==2){ // Outlets
00223                 if(arg < x->num_inputs) 
00224                         strcpy(dst, "(signal) connect to the algorithm");
00225                 else if(arg == x->num_inputs) 
00226                         strcpy(dst, "connect to algorithm");
00227                 else 
00228                         strcpy(dst, "dumpout");
00229         }
00230 }
00231 
00232 
00233 // messages received from jcom.hub for the algorithm
00234 void in_algorithm_message(t_in *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00235 {
00236         char            namestring[256];
00237         t_symbol        *osc;
00238 
00239         if((argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_audio_mute) || (argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_slash_audio_mute)){
00240                 x->attr_mute = atom_getlong(argv+1);
00241                 outlet_anything(x->algout, ps_mute, argc-1, argv+1);
00242         }
00243         else if((argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_video_mute) || (argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_slash_video_mute))
00244                 x->attr_mute = atom_getlong(argv+1);
00245         else if((argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_video_bypass) || (argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_slash_video_bypass))
00246                 x->attr_bypass = atom_getlong(argv+1);
00247         else if((argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_video_freeze) || (argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_slash_video_freeze))
00248                 x->attr_freeze = atom_getlong(argv+1);
00249         
00250         strcpy(namestring, "/");                                                // perhaps we could optimize this operation
00251         strcat(namestring, argv->a_w.w_sym->s_name);    //      by creating a table when the param is bound
00252         osc = gensym(namestring);                                               //      then we could look-up the symbol instead of using gensym()
00253 
00254         outlet_anything(x->algout, osc, argc-1, argv+1);
00255 }
00256

00258 void in_view_internals(t_in *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00259 {
00260         outlet_anything(x->algout, ps_open, 0, 0L);
00261 }

00266 {
00267         ;
00268 }

00271 // set pointer to the out object so we can forward messages to it 
00272 void in_link(t_in *x, t_object *y)
00273 {
00274         x->out_object = y;
00275 }

00277 
00278 void in_unlink(t_in *x)
00279 {
00280         x->out_object = NULL;
00281 }

00283 
00284 void in_bang(t_in *x)
00285 {
00286         if(x->attr_mute)
00287                 ;
00288         else if(x->attr_freeze)
00289                 object_method(x->out_object, ps_sendlastvalue);
00290         else if(x->attr_bypass)
00291                 object_method(x->out_object, ps_sendbypassedvalue, proxy_getinlet((t_object *)x), _sym_bang, 0, NULL);
00292         else
00293                 outlet_bang(x->outlet[proxy_getinlet((t_object *)x)]);
00294 }
00295 
00296 
00297 void in_int(t_in *x, long value)
00298 {
00299         if(x->attr_mute)
00300                 ;
00301         else if(x->attr_freeze)
00302                 object_method(x->out_object, ps_sendlastvalue);
00303         else if(x->attr_bypass){
00304                 t_atom a;
00305                 atom_setlong(&a, value);
00306                 object_method(x->out_object, ps_sendbypassedvalue, proxy_getinlet((t_object *)x), _sym_int, 1, &a);
00307         }
00308         else
00309                 outlet_int(x->outlet[proxy_getinlet((t_object *)x)], value);
00310 }
00311 
00312 
00313 void in_float(t_in *x, double value)
00314 {
00315         if(x->attr_mute)
00316                 ;
00317         else if(x->attr_freeze)
00318                 object_method(x->out_object, ps_sendlastvalue);
00319         else if(x->attr_bypass){
00320                 t_atom a;
00321                 atom_setfloat(&a, value);
00322                 object_method(x->out_object, ps_sendbypassedvalue, proxy_getinlet((t_object *)x), _sym_float, 1, &a);
00323         }
00324         else
00325                 outlet_float(x->outlet[proxy_getinlet((t_object *)x)], value);
00326 }
00327 
00328 
00329 void in_anything(t_in *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00330 {
00331         if(x->attr_mute)
00332                 ;
00333         else if(x->attr_freeze)
00334                 object_method(x->out_object, ps_sendlastvalue);
00335         else if(x->attr_bypass)
00336                 object_method(x->out_object, ps_sendbypassedvalue, proxy_getinlet((t_object *)x), msg, argc, argv);
00337         else
00338                 outlet_anything(x->outlet[proxy_getinlet((t_object *)x)], msg, argc, argv);
00339 }

00341 
00342 // Perform Method - just pass the whole vector straight through
00343 // (the work is all done in the dsp method)
00344 t_int *in_perform(t_int *w)
00345 {
00346         t_in    *x = (t_in *)(w[1]);            // Instance
00347         short   n;
00348         short   chan = x->num_inputs;
00349         short   i, j;
00350         float   *out, *remote;
00351         
00352         for(i=0; i < chan; i++){
00353                 n = x->vector_size;
00354                 remote = x->remote_vectors[i];
00355                 out = x->out_vectors[i];
00356                 j = 0;
00357                 if(out && x->signal_in->sampleVectors[i]){
00358                         if(remote){
00359                                 while(n--){
00360                                         x->signal_in->sampleVectors[i][j] += *remote;
00361                                         *out++ = x->signal_in->sampleVectors[i][j];
00362                                         *remote = 0.0;
00363                                         remote++;
00364                                         j++;
00365                                 } 
00366                         }
00367                         else{
00368                                 while(n--){
00369                                         *out++ = x->signal_in->sampleVectors[i][j];
00370                                         j++;
00371                                 } 
00372                         }
00373                 }
00374         }
00375         return(w+2);
00376 }

00379 // TODO: We are not guaranteed that this will be called after in_perform, right?
00380 // If that is so then our mixing is bogus, and perform needs to perform mixing too...
00381 void in_remoteaudio(t_in *x, float *audioVectors[], long numAudioVectors)
00382 {
00383         short   i;
00384         float   *vector, *out;
00385         long    n;
00386         
00387         for(i=0; i<numAudioVectors; i++){
00388                 vector = audioVectors[i];
00389                 n = x->vector_size;
00390                 out = x->remote_vectors[i];
00391                 while(n--)
00392                         *out++ += *vector++;
00393         }
00394 }
00395 
00396 
00397 // DSP Method
00398 void in_dsp(t_in *x, t_signal **sp, short *count)
00399 {
00400         short   i, j;
00401 
00402         in_alloc(x, sp[0]->s_n);                // Vector Size
00403 
00404         for(i=0; i < x->num_inputs; i++){       //take a look at each
00405                 if(count[i])
00406                         x->signal_in->setVector(i, sp[i]->s_vec);
00407                 else
00408                         x->signal_in->setVector(i, NULL);
00409         }
00410         
00411         j=i;
00412         for(i=0; i < x->num_inputs; i++, j++){
00413                 if(count[i])
00414                         x->out_vectors[i] = sp[j]->s_vec;
00415                 else
00416                         x->out_vectors[i] = NULL;
00417         }
00418         dsp_add(in_perform, 1, x);
00419 }
00420 
00421 
00422 void in_alloc(t_in *x, int vector_size)
00423 {
00424         short i;
00425         
00426         if(vector_size != x->vector_size) {
00427                 x->vector_size = vector_size;
00428                 x->signal_in->numChannels = MAX_NUM_CHANNELS;
00429                 x->signal_in->vs = vector_size;
00430                 x->signal_in->alloc();
00431 
00432                 for(i=0; i < MAX_NUM_CHANNELS; i++){
00433                         if(x->remote_vectors[i])
00434                                 sysmem_freeptr(x->remote_vectors[i]);
00435                         x->remote_vectors[i] = (float*)sysmem_newptr(sizeof(float) * x->vector_size);
00436                 }
00437         }
00438 }
